English.alert_about:
Trigger shortcuts to run on remote iOS devices and let others run shortcuts on this device using shared notes.

Run shortcuts automatically when using NoteCuts with Cronios.
English.alert_cleanNote: The note has been cleaned of the ‚ö°Ô∏è‚ö°Ô∏è iCloud Sync Delimiter. The new text has been copied to the clipboard, and you can paste it into this note.
English.alert_evaluation: Evaluating local NoteCuts for any shortcuts to run on this device‚Ä¶
English.alert_evaluation_continuously: NoteCuts will begin continuous monitoring of your local NoteCuts for shortcut commands in {{Time}} seconds.
English.alert_import_cronJob:
Tap OK to import into Cronios.

If Import Active Status is enabled in Cronios Settings, the cron job will run automatically when you enter `Run Continuously` mode in Cronios. Otherwise edit the cron job and tap Enable.

From the Edit screen, you can also adjust the cron schedule expression better suit the frequency of checks, which is currently set to every {{frequency}} minute(s).
English.alert_import_none:
Either no notes could be found to import, or all possible notes are associated with existing NoteCuts.

Notes supported by NoteCuts have titles of `NoteCuts (XYZ)` where XYZ is the name of the NoteCut.
English.alert_instructions:
Usage:

1. Enter shortcuts you want to run at the end of this document. Separate each shortcut with a new line.

2. Prefix shortcuts with ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to run them the next time this note is evaluated by NoteCuts based on the NoteCut type:

LOCAL: The shortcuts will run on this iOS device.

REMOTE: The shortcuts will run on any remote iOS device that has associated this shared note with a local NoteCut.

Available options after the shortcut name include üîí (Lock Detection) ‚òÅÔ∏è (Network Access Required) ‚úã (Requires User Interaction) and üí¨ (Optional Shortcut Input).
English.alert_new_note:
You can share this note with other people.

If they add the name of a shortcut prefixed by ‚ñ∂Ô∏è, your shortcut will automatically run when you either:

‚Ä¢¬†Run this shortcut

‚Ä¢¬†Run this shortcut via Cronios.
English.alert_shortcuts_cache: Updating the list of shortcuts on this device. This may take a few moments.
English.alert_update_none: You are currently running the latest version of NoteCuts.
English.alert_watcher_clipboard:
NoteCuts will now open Scriptable to a new Script window. Paste the contents of the clipboard and name the script `NoteCuts Watcher`.

Run it once and activate NoteCuts Watcher in NoteCuts Settings.
English.alert_watcher_clipboard_title: NoteCuts Watcher Script Copied to the Clipboard
English.alert_watcher_disabled: You will no longer be notified when NoteCuts stops running.
English.alert_welcome_1:
NoteCuts automatically runs shortcuts on local or remote iOS devices using shared notes in Apple Notes, Evernote, and Dropbox.

NoteCuts can shortcuts in the background, even when the iOS device is locked and asleep.

By Adam Tow ‚Ä¢ tow.com
@atow ‚Ä¢¬†/u/adamtow

https://tow.com/shortcuts/notecuts
English.alert_welcome_2:
A note that is connected to NoteCuts is called a NoteCut. There are two types of NoteCuts:

LOCAL: Shortcuts added to a local note can be run on this iOS device. A person with shared access to this note can remotely request a shortcut to run on this device.

REMOTE: Shortcuts added to remote note are run on another iOS device. You can queue a shortcut to run on the remote device by adding a shortcut command to the shared note.
English.alert_welcome_3:
NoteCuts can continually look in your notes for new shortcuts to run automatically and in the background, even when your iOS device is locked and asleep.

NoteCuts also works with Cronios, the shortcuts scheduler for iOS.

And with NoteCuts Watcher, you can be notified when NoteCuts stops prematurely. With one tap, you can relaunch NoteCuts in continuous monitoring mode.
English.alert_welcome_3_title: Run Shortcuts Automatically in the Background
English.alert_welcome_4:
NoteCuts is highly configurable. Visit Settings to set up NoteCuts to suit your style and workflow.

For complete documentation on how to use NoteCuts, tap Help from the NoteCuts Home screen.
English.error_offline: You must be connected to the internet to check for updates.
English.label_pollingInterval: Check for new shortcut commands every
English.label_shortcuts_available: Shortcuts containing the following keywords are available to run from this note:
English.label_shortcuts_availableAll: All shortcuts on this device can be run from this note.
English.menu_run_continuously_description: Continually checks for new shortcut commands.
English.menu_run_once_description: Checks once for new shortcut commands.
English.menu_settings_appleNotesUpdate_descripti: Updates Apple Notes even when Notes is inactive.
Apple Notes updates only when Notes is active.
English.menu_settings_cacheShortcuts_description: Refresh the cache whenever you add or remove shortcuts.
Get My Shortcuts will be used to retrieve shortcuts (slower).
English.menu_settings_notifyShortcut_description: Sends Cronios dictionary as input to shortcut.
English.menu_settings_watcher_description: Scriptable and NoteCuts Watcher must be installed.
English.message_notify: I have added shortcuts for you to run. Use the link below or open NoteCuts in the Shortcuts app and tap Evaluate Local NoteCuts.
English.prompt_donate: Enjoying NoteCuts to automate running your shortcuts? Leave me a tip!
English.prompt_edit_addText: Add text to this note. To run a shortcut on the remote iOS device, remember to prefix the shortcut name with ‚ñ∂Ô∏è.
English.prompt_edit_dropboxPath: Enter the folder path to the file on Dropbox.
English.prompt_edit_evernoteNotebook: Enter the name of the Evernote Notebook where this shared note resides.
English.prompt_edit_evernoteTags: Enter tags for this shared note.
English.prompt_edit_shortcuts:
Enter the list of keywords (case-sensitive) that will match all shortcuts that can be triggered from this note.

Leave blank to allow any shortcut to run.

Separate shortcuts by new lines.
English.prompt_erase_content:
Are you sure you want to delete all NoteCuts content and settings for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt_erase_content2:
Are you ABSOLUTELY SURE you want to delete all NoteCuts content and settings for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt_erase_logs:
Are you sure you want to delete all NoteCuts logs for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt_frequency:
Add or Update the cron job in Cronios

How often do you want this shortcut's cron job to run in Cronios? Check times begin from the top of the minute.
English.prompt_import: Choose notes to import as new local or remote NoteCuts.
English.prompt_new_note:
Enter the name for the new NoteCut.

If an existing note exists with that name, you can link the note to the new NoteCut.

Otherwise, a new note called:

`NoteCuts (XYZ)` will be created where XYZ is the name you enter.
English.prompt_new_type: Where will the new note be located?
English.prompt_note_exists: A note with this name already exists. Associate it with NoteCuts?
English.prompt_open_note: Would you like to open the note?
English.prompt_pollingInterval:
Choose how often (in seconds) you want to check for changes in your NoteCuts associated notes.

For intervals longer than one minute, use NoteCuts with Cronios (cronios.com).
English.prompt_quarantine: Selected shortcuts will remain in quarantine and will not be run by NoteCuts.
English.prompt_remove: This operation will disassociate the note as a trigger for running shortcuts, but the actual note will not be affected.
English.prompt_reset: Reset NoteCuts settings or erase all content and settings for NoteCuts?
English.prompt_reset_settings:
Are you sure you want to reset NoteCuts settings on this device?

None of your NoteCuts or logs will be affected.
English.prompt_shortcuts_selected: What do you want to do with the selected shortcuts?
English.prompt_trigger_type:
What kind of NoteCut do you want to create?

‚Ä¢ LOCAL: Lets others trigger shortcuts to run on this device.

‚Ä¢¬†REMOTE: Trigger and run shortcuts on remote iOS devices.
English.prompt_view_shortcuts: Select shortcuts that can be triggered from this NoteCut.
English.prompt_watcher:
Get notified when NoteCuts stops running and relaunch NoteCuts in continuous monitoring mode with one tap. This feature requires:

1. NoteCuts Daemon Shortcut
2. Scriptable from the App Store
3. NoteCuts Watcher Scriptable Script

Confirm that you have installed each item before enabling this feature.
English.prompt_welcome: What do you want to do next in NoteCuts?
English.tip_appleNotes:
Changes to Apple Notes will not be synced when your iOS device is locked.

If your device wakes up but remains unlocked, it may cause NoteCuts to stop monitoring.

Use notes on Evernote or Dropbox if you plan on using NoteCuts primarily in the background.
English.tip_appleNotes_title: Tips for Using NoteCuts with Apple Notes
English.tip_notify: Notify people who have associated this note with a local NoteCut that shortcuts are ready to run.
English.tip_runContinuously:
1. Use NoteCuts associated with files on Dropbox or notes in Evernote. NoteCuts attached to Apple Notes may stop automatic monitoring if the device screen turns on when the device is locked and asleep.

2. Play music, a podcast, or silent audio if you plan to lock this device.

3. Enable the NoteCuts Watcher for one tap relaunching of NoteCuts when it does stop monitoring prematurely.

Note: Every minute, NoteCuts will speak a quick beep. This beep helps NoteCuts stay running in the background.
